titles.ar: باب الرَّجُلِ يُمْسِكُ الرَّجُلَ فَيَقْتُلُهُ آخَرُ
titles.en: Chapter 10 – The man restrains the man, so another one kills him

titles.ar: باب الرَّجُلِ يَقَعُ عَلَى الرَّجُلِ فَيَقْتُلُهُ
titles.en: Chapter 11 – The man falls upon the man so he kills him

titles.ar: باب الرَّجُلِ يُخَلِّصُ مَنْ وَجَبَ عَلَيْهِ الْقَوَدُ
titles.en: Chapter 9 – The man discharged from the retaliation being Obligated upon him

titles.ar: باب الرَّجُلِ يُمْسِكُ الرَّجُلَ فَيَقْتُلُهُ آخَرُ
titles.en: Chapter 10 – The man restrains the man, so another one kills him

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ وَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ جَمِيعاً عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عُثْمَانَ عَنِ الْحَلَبِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: قَضَى أَمِيرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( عليه السلام ) فِي رَجُلَيْنِ أَمْسَكَ أَحَدُهُمَا وَ قَتَلَ الْآخَرُ قَالَ يُقْتَلُ الْقَاتِلُ وَ يُحْبَسُ الْآخَرُ حَتَّى يَمُوتَ غَمّاً كَمَا كَانَ حَبَسَهُ عَلَيْهِ حَتَّى مَاتَ غَمّاً .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim from his father, and Muhammad Bin Yahya from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, both together from Ibn Umeyr, from Hammad Bin Usman, from Al Halby,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup> judged regarding two men, one of whom restrained, and the other one killed. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘The killer would be killed, and the other one would be imprisoned until he dies in anguish just as he held him until he died in anguish’.

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ يُونُسَ عَنْ زُرْعَةَ عَنْ سَمَاعَةَ قَالَ

text: قَضَى أَمِيرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( عليه السلام ) فِي رَجُلٍ شَدَّ عَلَى رَجُلٍ لِيَقْتُلَهُ وَ الرَّجُلُ فَارٌّ مِنْهُ فَاسْتَقْبَلَهُ رَجُلٌ آخَرُ فَأَمْسَكَهُ عَلَيْهِ حَتَّى جَاءَ الرَّجُلُ فَقَتَلَهُ فَقَتَلَ الرَّجُلَ الَّذِي قَتَلَهُ وَ قَضَى عَلَى الْآخَرِ الَّذِي أَمْسَكَهُ عَلَيْهِ أَنْ يُطْرَحَ فِي السِّجْنِ أَبَداً حَتَّى يَمُوتَ فِيهِ لِأَنَّهُ أَمْسَكَهُ عَلَى الْمَوْتِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from Muhammad Bin Isa, from Yunus, from Zur’at, from Sama’at who said,

‘Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup> judged regarding a man who was intense upon a man in order to kill him, and the man fled from him, so another man came across him, so he restrained him until the other man came over, so he killed him. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘The man who killed him would be killed, and the judgement upon the other one who restrained him is that he would be thrown into the prison forever until he dies in it, because he restrained him to the death’.

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِهِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْفُضَيْلِ عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ أَبِي الْمِقْدَامِ قَالَ

text: كُنْتُ شَاهِداً عِنْدَ الْبَيْتِ الْحَرَامِ وَ رَجُلٌ يُنَادِي بِأَبِي جَعْفَرٍ الْمَنْصُورِ وَ هُوَ يَطُوفُ وَ يَقُولُ يَا أَمِيرَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ إِنَّ هَذَيْنِ الرَّجُلَيْنِ طَرَقَا أَخِي لَيْلًا فَأَخْرَجَاهُ مِنْ مَنْزِلِهِ فَلَمْ يَرْجِعْ إِلَيَّ وَ اللَّهِ مَا أَدْرِي مَا صَنَعَا بِهِ فَقَالَ لَهُمَا مَا صَنَعْتُمَا بِهِ فَقَالَا يَا أَمِيرَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ كَلَّمْنَاهُ فَرَجَعَ إِلَى مَنْزِلِهِ فَقَالَ لَهُمَا وَافِيَانِي غَداً صَلَاةَ الْعَصْرِ فِي هَذَا الْمَكَانِ

فَوَافَوْهُ مِنَ الْغَدِ صَلَاةَ الْعَصْرِ وَ حَضَرْتُهُ فَقَالَ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ ( عليه السلام ) وَ هُوَ قَابِضٌ عَلَى يَدِهِ يَا جَعْفَرُ اقْضِ بَيْنَهُمْ فَقَالَ يَا أَمِيرَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ اقْضِ بَيْنَهُمْ أَنْتَ فَقَالَ لَهُ بِحَقِّي عَلَيْكَ إِلَّا قَضَيْتَ بَيْنَهُمْ

قَالَ فَخَرَجَ جَعْفَرٌ ( عليه السلام ) فَطُرِحَ لَهُ مُصَلَّى قَصَبٍ فَجَلَسَ عَلَيْهِ ثُمَّ جَاءَ الْخُصَمَاءُ فَجَلَسُوا قُدَّامَهُ فَقَالَ مَا تَقُولُ قَالَ يَا ابْنَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ إِنَّ هَذَيْنِ طَرَقَا أَخِي لَيْلًا فَأَخْرَجَاهُ مِنْ مَنْزِلِهِ فَوَ اللَّهِ مَا رَجَعَ إِلَيَّ وَ وَ اللَّهِ مَا أَدْرِي مَا صَنَعَا بِهِ فَقَالَ مَا تَقُولَانِ فَقَالَا يَا ابْنَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ كَلَّمْنَاهُ ثُمَّ رَجَعَ إِلَى مَنْزِلِهِ

فَقَالَ جَعْفَرٌ ( عليه السلام ) يَا غُلَامُ اكْتُبْ بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَنِ الرَّحِيمِ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) كُلُّ مَنْ طَرَقَ رَجُلًا بِاللَّيْلِ فَأَخْرَجَهُ مِنْ مَنْزِلِهِ فَهُوَ لَهُ ضَامِنٌ إِلَّا أَنْ يُقِيمَ الْبَيِّنَةَ أَنَّهُ قَدْ رَدَّهُ إِلَى مَنْزِلِهِ يَا غُلَامُ نَحِّ هَذَا فَاضْرِبْ عُنُقَهُ فَقَالَ يَا ابْنَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ وَ اللَّهِ مَا أَنَا قَتَلْتُهُ وَ لَكِنِّي أَمْسَكْتُهُ ثُمَّ جَاءَ هَذَا فَوَجَأَهُ فَقَتَلَهُ فَقَالَ أَنَا ابْنُ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ يَا غُلَامُ نَحِّ هَذَا وَ اضْرِبْ عُنُقَ الْآخَرِ فَقَالَ يَا ابْنَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ وَ اللَّهِ مَا عَذَّبْتُهُ وَ لَكِنِّي قَتَلْتُهُ بِضَرْبَةٍ وَاحِدَةٍ
فَأَمَرَ أَخَاهُ فَضَرَبَ عُنُقَهُ ثُمَّ أَمَرَ بِالْآخَرِ فَضَرَبَ جَنْبَيْهِ وَ حَبَسَهُ فِي السِّجْنِ وَ وَقَّعَ عَلَى رَأْسِهِ يُحْبَسُ عُمُرَهُ وَ يُضْرَبُ فِي كُلِّ سَنَةٍ خَمْسِينَ جَلْدَةً.

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Isa, from one of his companions, from Muhammad Bin Al Fuzayl, from Amro Bin Abu Al Miqdam who said,

‘I was present at the Sacred House (Kabah) and a man called out to Abu Ja’far Al Mansour (the Caliph), and he was circumambulating, and he was saying, ‘O commander of the faithful! These two men went to my brother at night and took him out from his house, and he has not returned to me. By Allah<sup>azwj</sup>! I do not know what these two have done with him’. So he said to the two, ‘What did you two do to him?’ So they both said, ‘O commander of the faithful! We (only) spoke to him and returned him back to his home’. So he said to them both, ‘Meet me tomorrow after Al-Asr Prayer, and this very place’.

So they both came the next day after Al-Asr Prayer, and he was present. So he said to Ja’far Bin Muhammad<sup>asws</sup>, and he had grabbed his<sup>asws</sup> hand, ‘O Ja’far<sup>asws</sup>! Judge between them’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said, ‘O commander of the faithful, you judge between them’. So he said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘By my right upon you<sup>asws</sup>, (it shall not be) except that you<sup>asws</sup> would judge between them’.

He (the narrator) said, ‘So Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> came out, and a Prayer mat of reeds was spread out for him<sup>asws</sup>, and he<sup>asws</sup> sat upon it. Then the disputants came over, so they sat facing him<sup>asws</sup>. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘What are you saying? ‘He said, ‘O son<sup>asws</sup> of Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup>! These two went over to my brother at night, so they brought him out from his home. By Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, he has not returned to me, and by Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, I do not know what they both did to him’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘So what are you two saying?’ So they both said, ‘O son<sup>asws</sup> of Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup>! We spoke to him, then he returned to his home’.

So Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘O slave, write! In the Name of Allah<sup>azwj</sup> the Beneficent, the Merciful! Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘Everyone who comes to a man at night, so he brings him out from his home, so he is responsible for him except if the proof is established that he has returned him to his home’. O slave! Seize this one, so strike his neck!’ So he said, ‘O son<sup>asws</sup> of Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup>! By Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, it was not I that killed him, but I restrained him, then this one came over, so he ambushed him and killed him’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘I<sup>asws</sup> am son<sup>asws</sup> of Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup>, O slave! Seize this one, and strike the neck of the other one’. So he (the other one) said, ‘O son<sup>asws</sup> of Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup>! By Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, I did not torment him, but I killed him with one strike’.

So he<sup>asws</sup> ordered his (deceased’s) brother, so he struck off his neck. Then he<sup>asws</sup> ordered for the other one, so he struck his side, and to be withheld in the prison, and wrote upon his head: ‘To be held for his life, and he should be whipped every year with fifty lashes’.

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ النَّوْفَلِيِّ عَنِ السَّكُونِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَنَّ

text: ثَلَاثَةَ نَفَرٍ رُفِعُوا إِلَى أَمِيرِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( عليه السلام ) وَاحِدٌ مِنْهُمْ أَمْسَكَ رَجُلًا وَ أَقْبَلَ آخَرُ فَقَتَلَهُ وَ الْآخَرُ يَرَاهُمْ فَقَضَى فِي الرُّؤْيَةِ أَنْ تُسْمَلَ عَيْنَاهُ وَ فِي الَّذِي أَمْسَكَ أَنْ يُسْجَنَ حَتَّى يَمُوتَ كَمَا أَمْسَكَهُ وَ قَضَى فِي الَّذِي قَتَلَ أَنْ يُقْتَلَ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Al Nowfaly, from Al Sakuny,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> that (the matter of) three persons was raised to Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup>, one of them had restrained a man, and the other faced him so he killed him, and the other one watched them. He<sup>asws</sup> judged regarding the on-looker that his eyes be gouged out, and regarding the one who restrained that he should be imprisoned until he dies just as he had restrained him, and judged regarding the one who killed, that he should be killed’.
